title: UK PM May confident Brexit deal will be reached
description:
(4 Oct 2017) British Prime Minister Theresa May said she is confident that a Brexit deal will be reached that will work for Britain and Europe.
May says "it is profoundly in our interests for the negotiations to succeed" and result in a new relationship between the UK and the European Union.
But she says "it is our responsibility as a government to prepare for every eventuality. And let me reassure everyone in this hall - that is exactly what we are doing."
Both Britain and the EU have expressed impatience with the slow progress of Brexit talks, which are bogged down in details of the divorce agreement.
May also said that EU nationals that have made a life for themselves in the UK are valued and she urged Brexit negotiating teams to reach an agreement on their future quickly.
